Ministry for the Environment.scope: This output class is limited to contributing to and monitoring of domestic environmental management programmes and educational programmes promoting awareness of environmental issues.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Environmental Hazards and Waste Policy Advice
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This output class is limited to policy advice, ministerial servicing, development, review and monitoring of tools, frameworks and institutions including international agreements, conventions and obligations in relation to the risks posed by environmental hazards and waste.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Marine Environment Policy Advice
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This output class is limited to policy advice, development, review and monitoring of tools, frameworks and institutions and ministerial servicing in relation to the marine environment.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Waste Minimisation Administration
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This appropriation is limited to the collection and administration of the waste levy and assessing and monitoring costs relating to projects considered or approved for funding from the waste levy.

Ministry for the Environment.name: International Obligations and Institutions
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This output class is limited to advice on international environmental arrangements, agreements and partnerships; contributing to negotiations with international parties on environmental issues; and undertaking implementation, reporting, monitoring and compliance activities in line with international arrangements, agreements and partnerships.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Developing and Implementing Treaty Settlements and Environmental Accords
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This output class is limited to advice on environmental accords with Maori and Treaty settlements involving natural resources; contributing to negotiations with iwi and affected parties on environmental issues as part of developing deeds of settlement and monitoring relevant sections of deeds of settlement.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Contaminated Sites Remediation Fund
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This appropriation is limited to the investigation, management and remediation of contaminated sites.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Purchase of PRE Units
Ministry for the Environment.scope: Purchasing of PRE emission units by the Crown from the Projects to Reduce Emissions (PRE) portfolio.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Warm Homes Grants and Assistance
Ministry for the Environment.scope: Crown's contribution to assist with installation of clean and energy efficient heating with a particular focus on the homes of low income earners.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Impairment of Debt Relating to the New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This appropriation is limited to the impairment and write-down of debt arising from the collection of revenue under the New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Purchase of Units under the New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase and surrender of units under Section 159 of the Climate Change Response Act 2002.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Waikato River Co-Governance
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This appropriation is limited to the governance and operational costs of Waikato River co-governance.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Administration of New Zealand Units held on Trust
Ministry for the Environment.scope: This appropriation is limited to the application for and holding on trust of New Zealand Units on behalf of the future owners of Crown Forest Licensed land.

Ministry for the Environment.name: Framework Convention on Climate Change
Ministry for the Environment.scope: New Zealand's contribution to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.

Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.name: Domestic Biosecurity Surveillance
Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.scope: This output class is limited to domestic biosecurity surveillance activities.

Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.name: Fisheries enforcement and monitoring

Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.name: Border Biosecurity Systems Development and Maintenance

Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.scope: This appropriation is limited to the Global Research Alliance on Agricultural Greenhouse Gases.

Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.name: East Coast Afforestation Grants
Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.scope: This appropriation is limited to grants under the Forestry (East Coast) Grants Regulations 1992.

Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.name: Animal Welfare Education and Enforcement
Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.scope: This appropriation is limited to standard setting, education and enforcement intended to improve animal welfare in New Zealand.

Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.name: Aquaculture

Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.scope: This output class is limited to policy advice and analysis on animal welfare, and ministerial servicing.

Predominantly expected to cover purchase of fuel against the event that the plant is required to generate reserve electricity.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Biodiesel Grants

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Enforcement of Telecommunications Sector Regulation

It also includes purchase of ownership and purchase advice on Crown entities.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Rugby World Cup Leverage and Legacy Programmes
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of Rugby World Cup leverage and legacy programmes (both offshore and onshore).

Does not include cost of supply of reserve energy (fuel) or implementation of emergency measures.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Performance of Investigation and Enforcement Functions

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Establishment and operation of the Food Innovation Network New Zealand
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the establishment and operation of the Food Innovation Network New Zealand.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Investment in the Financial Markets Authority

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Accounting and Assurance Standards Setting

Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the regulation of electricity lines businesses and Transpower under Part 4 of the Commerce Act 1986 and residual administration of the repealed Part 4A of the Commerce Act 1986.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Regional and Industry Development Fund
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of funding to support industry and regional specific projects that are intended to contribute to economic growth.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: New Zealand Trade and Enterprise

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Promoting and Facilitating Customer Switching
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to facilitating, and promoting increased switching of electricity suppliers to consumers.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Management of IEA Oil Stocks
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: For the cost of managing and funding of oil stocks to meet International Energy Agency obligations.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Financial Markets Authority Litigation Fund
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to meeting the cost of major litigation activity arising from the enforcement of financial markets and securities markets law.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Investment Fund Management

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Measurement and Product Safety Compliance and Enforcement
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to compliance and enforcement activities to ensure a supportive measurement and product safety infrastructure for business and consumers.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Maintenance and Operation of Whirinaki

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Depreciation on Auckland's Queens Wharf
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to depreciation expenses associated with Auckland's Queens Wharf.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Reserve Energy and Emergency Measures - Variable Costs

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Square Kilometre Array

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Temporary Rugby World Cup showcase and festival building on Auckland's Queens Wharf

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Implementation of the Tourism Strategy
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to third party expenses in implementing the New Zealand Tourism Strategy 2015.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Sector Strategies and Facilitation
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Assistance with the facilitation of specific sector initiatives, particularly in the areas of major events, pre-feasibility and feasibility studies and guarantees for significant projects to access funding through other government programmes and cash grants.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Rugby World Cup
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to performance of the functions relating to the Rugby World Cup Authority.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Transformational Initiatives Fund
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Funding for the implementation of policy on transformational initiatives as agreed by Cabinet.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Administration of Trade Remedies
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to investigative services including ministerial servicing to establish whether New Zealand industries require remedies to prevent injury caused by dumped or subsidised imports or sudden import surges.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Grants and Assistance
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the Crown's contribution to fund improvements to the energy efficiency of New Zealand businesses and homes and increased use of renewable energy.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Statutory Management - Aorangi Securities Limited and Others
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of services by the statutory managers and others within the scope of section 66(1) of the Corporations (Investigation and Management) Act 1989.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Rugby World Cup Free-to-Air Broadcasting Right
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to meeting the government contribution to the joint bid by the Maori Television Service, Television New Zealand and Mediaworks for the Rugby World Cup free-to-air broadcasting right.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Contributions to International Telecommunications Organisations
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: The Crown's annual membership of the Asia Pacific Telecommunity and subscription to the International Telecommunications Union.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Enforcement of Dairy Sector Regulation
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Commerce Commission funding for dispute resolution relating to and enforcement of the Dairy Industry Restructuring Act 2001 and related regulations.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Film New Zealand
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Operation of an independent structure for Film NZ, development of a marketing plan for the film sector and coordination of regional film offices.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Ratana Housing Repairs
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the repair of housing at Ratana to a standard which improves the overall safety and energy efficiency of the house and enables the installation of clean-heating devices and insulation.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Management Support of the National Cycleway
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of support and advice for the National Cycleway Fund, support services for the Cycleway Advisory Group and associated ministerial servicing.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Contributions to International Organisations
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Annual fee for New Zealand's membership of the International Copyright and Patent Union; International Patent Documentation Centre; International Standards Association; International Union for the Protection of New Plant Varieties; and a share of New Zealand's annual subscription and obligations arising from the Basel Convention.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Investment in the Accounting Standards Review Board/External Reporting Board
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to capital requirements to establish the External Reporting Board

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Electricity Litigation Fund
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to ensuring that the regulatory body for the electricity industry is able to participate in litigation effectively and without delay.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Regulation of Auditors
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the oversight and regulation of professional accounting bodies, auditing firms and auditors for the purpose of promoting audit quality.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Regulation of Airport Services
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the regulation of specified airport services provided by Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch International Airports, under Part 4 of the Commerce Act 1986.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Input Methodologies
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the development, implementation, monitoring and administration of input methodologies relating to regulated businesses as prescribed under Part 4 of the Commerce Act 1986.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Administration of Part II Tariff Concessions
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Assessing applications by importers to be exempted from import duties under the tariff concessions policy.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Tourism Facilities Development Grants
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Government Grants for non-commercial, nationally significant tourism facilities.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Takeovers Panel Litigation Fund
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to meeting the cost of major litigation activity undertaken by the Takeovers Panel arising from it carrying out functions under the Takeovers Act 1993 and the Takeovers Code.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Acquisition of Textphone Equipment
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: To purchase textphones after the establishment of a textphone pool for deaf, hearing impaired and speech impaired people.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: Ministry of Energy Residual Liabilities
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Payment of residual liabilities of the former Ministry of Energy and to meet urgent mine restoration and rehabilitation relating to the operations of the state coal mines prior to 1987.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: International Energy Agency Subscription
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Payment of annual subscription for membership of the International Energy Agency.

Ministry of Economic Development.name: International Energy Agency Contribution
Ministry of Economic Development.scope: Payment of contributions towards the cost of energy-related research undertaken by the International Energy Agency.

Ministry of Education.name: Primary Education
Ministry of Education.scope: Delivering the curriculum for Years 0 to 8 (new entrant to Form 2) to pupils of State, integrated, private schools and The Correspondence School.  Provides roll-based operations funding to schools, teacher and management salaries, support costs and supplementary funding programmes.

Ministry of Education.name: Secondary Education
Ministry of Education.scope: Delivering the curriculum for Years 9 to 13 (Forms 3 to 7) to pupils of State, integrated, private schools and The Correspondence School.  Provides roll-based operations funding to schools, teacher and management salaries, support costs and supplementary funding programmes.

Ministry of Education.name: Tertiary Education: Student Achievement Component
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding for teaching and learning services for enrolled students in approved courses at tertiary education organisations to achieve recognised tertiary qualifications.

Ministry of Education.name: Early Childhood Education
Ministry of Education.scope: Subsidising early childhood education services for children under six years of age from licensed and chartered early childhood education services (including centres and chartered home-based care networks) and from licence-exempt and certificated centres.  Also included are several targeted funds.

Ministry of Education.name: School Property Portfolio Management
Ministry of Education.scope: Expenditure on goods and services focused on providing the land, buildings and other facilities that make up the property portfolio of the State school sector.  This includes purchasing and constructing new property, upgrading existing property to maintain the quality of the portfolio, disposing of surplus property, and managing teacher and caretaker housing.

Ministry of Education.name: Ministry of Education  - Capital Expenditure
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Ministry of Education, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Ministry of Education.name: Special Needs Support
Ministry of Education.scope: Providing additional resources to enable students with special education needs to participate in education.  This includes supplementary resources for special education needs, residential services, English for Speakers of Other Languages and alternative education programmes.

Ministry of Education.name: Training for Designated Groups
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchasing and arranging of training linked to the New Zealand Qualifications Framework and the purchase of both on-job and off-job training places, including delivery of fully or partially funded training places and other industry-training related projects.

Ministry of Education.name: Interventions for Target Student Groups
Ministry of Education.scope: Expenditure on policies and services focused on targeted student groups’ or individuals’ participation in education.  This includes providing services to individuals with special education and developmental needs, providing additional funding for the support of students with special education needs, providing alternative education options, working with individuals and relevant stakeholders to resolve participation issues, and administering scholarships and awards for individuals.

Ministry of Education.name: Performance-Based Research Fund
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding research and research-based teaching on the basis of measured research quality in tertiary education organisations.

Ministry of Education.name: School Transport
Ministry of Education.scope: Purchase of services to transport eligible students to and from State and integrated schools.  Also included are payments to schools that manage their own transport services and payments to parents/caregivers to compensate for the costs of taking children to school where other transport services are unsuitable or unavailable.

Ministry of Education.name: Professional Development and Support
Ministry of Education.scope: Delivery of professional development and advisory support to staff, managers and parents in early childhood education services and in schools, to support effective teaching and enhance self-management.

Ministry of Education.name: Support and Resources for Teachers
Ministry of Education.scope: Expenditure on policies and services focused on supporting the work and enhancing the capability of teachers.  This includes providing curriculum and achievement standards, teaching resources, professional development, and administering scholarships and awards for teachers and principals.

Ministry of Education.name: Support and Resources for Education Providers
Ministry of Education.scope: Expenditure on policies, regulations and services focused on the governance, management and operation of education providers.  This includes managing regulations, administering the distribution of resources, delivering services that support school management - including industrial relations and education payroll - and working with providers to resolve underperformance.

Ministry of Education.name: Adult and Community Education
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing funding for delivery of non-formal adult and community education activities and services, including literacy and numeracy, and English for Speakers of Other Languages training, through tertiary education organisations, schools, and employers.

Ministry of Education.name: Curriculum Support
Ministry of Education.scope: Purchase of supplementary educational programmes for schools and communities to ensure wider access to these opportunities.

Ministry of Education.name: Integrated Schools Property
Ministry of Education.scope: Provision for modernisation of existing property at integrated schools as part of a funding regime negotiated with the proprietors of integrated schools.  Funding to assist in the expansion of the network is also included.

Ministry of Education.name: Managing the Government's Investment in the Tertiary Education Sector
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to developing, implementing and managing an investment system that aligns planning, funding, monitoring and quality assurance of tertiary education in accordance with the provisions of the Education Act 1989 and other relevant legislation.

Ministry of Education.name: Strategic Leadership in the Sector
Ministry of Education.scope: Expenditure on policies and services focused on the Ministry’s leadership role in the education sector.  This includes enhancing the Ministry’s coordination with other sector and Government agencies and forums, undertaking research and analysis, developing sector policy, monitoring the sector and select Crown entities, and supporting the Minister of Education and Associate Minister to meet their obligations to Parliament.

Ministry of Education.name: Centres of Research Excellence
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of cooperative and collaborative tertiary research in areas of research strength in the tertiary education sector through the contestable Centres of Research Excellence Fund.

Ministry of Education.name: Tertiary Education Grants and Other Funding
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing contestable funding and miscellaneous funding to tertiary education organisations.

Ministry of Education.name: Secondary School Assessments
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to the New Zealand Qualifications Authority overseeing assessment for national secondary school qualifications, including the National Certificate of Educational Achievement and Scholarship examinations, and the moderation of internal and external school assessments.

Ministry of Education.name: National Study Awards
Ministry of Education.scope: Provision for the costs of study awards, sabbaticals and fellowships for teachers, including replacement of the teacher while on study leave.  Awards include those linked to teachers’ collective agreements and approved prestigious awards.  Priorities, criteria and selection processes are published by the Ministry of Education.

Ministry of Education.name: Provision of Information and Advisory Services
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing a range of stakeholders with information, capability building and advisory services related to education policies and programmes.  This includes careers information, advice and guidance services, information on qualifications, assessment and quality assurance, communication and information services for the sensory sector as well as mobility, orientation and habilitation services, and support to assist with management, governance, licensing and capacity of providers.  Services from Career Services and New Zealand Qualifications Authority for Government Ministers are also included.

Ministry of Education.name: Support for Early Childhood Education Providers
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to assisting early childhood education services and other bodies corporate in the provision of child places for early childhood education. Priority will be given to providers in communities that have low levels of participation in early childhood education, to increase the number of child places and therefore availability of early childhood education. The criteria and selection process for each type of assistance are published by the Ministry of Education.

Ministry of Education.name: Schools Furniture and Equipment
Ministry of Education.scope: Provides funds to schools for new furniture and equipment when capital works (including remodelling/upgrading of existing property and new school property) are approved.

Ministry of Education.name: Teacher Trainee Scholarships
Ministry of Education.scope: Scholarships and allowances for students undertaking teacher training education, and loan support payments to teachers.  The criteria and process for awarding scholarships are published by the Ministry of Education.

Ministry of Education.name: Strategic Leadership in the Tertiary System
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenditure on policies and services focused on the Ministry's leadership role in the tertiary system.  This includes enhancing coordination with sector and Government agencies and forums, undertaking research and analysis, developing sector policy, monitoring the system, providing information on tertiary and international education services, representing the education sector internationally, supporting international students and supporting Ministers to meet their obligations to Parliament.

Ministry of Education.name: International Education Programmes
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to delivery of services in respect of international education, including promotion, information, research and professional development, both in New Zealand and overseas, for the purpose of managing and increasing the flow of international students and promoting international education linkages.

Ministry of Education.name: Tertiary Scholarships and Awards
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing scholarships for tertiary students and other awards in the tertiary sector, and the provision of scholarships and bursaries to Maori and Pasifika students. It includes training assistance under Queen Elizabeth II Study Awards and recognition of outstanding tertiary education teachers.  The guidelines, criteria and process for the various scholarships and awards are available from the Ministry of Education or the Tertiary Education Commission.

Ministry of Education.name: Support and Resources for the Community
Ministry of Education.scope: Expenditure on policies and programmes focused on the community’s knowledge of and participation in the education system.  This includes engaging with, providing information and support to, and delivering education courses to the community.

Ministry of Education.name: Schooling Improvement
Ministry of Education.scope: School support and schooling improvement projects to improve the capability of schools and school clusters and their responsiveness to the needs of their communities.  These include iwi-strengthening education projects.

Ministry of Education.name: Boarding Allowances and Bursaries
Ministry of Education.scope: Provides an annual allowance to subsidise boarding fees and some travel costs of primary and secondary students who must live away from home to receive their education, either because of the distance of the nearest school or bus service from their home, or because certain approved subjects are not available at their local schools.  Bursaries are awarded according to the School Boarding Bursaries Regulations 1972.

Ministry of Education.name: Qualifications Support Structures
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to the New Zealand Qualifications Authority overseeing the setting of standards and New Zealand qualifications. It also includes standard-setting and qualifications development responsibility, recognition and review of qualifications, records management processes to support the New Zealand Qualifications Framework, and participation in the promotion of the New Zealand qualifications system to key education and immigration partner countries.

Ministry of Education.name: Supporting Parenting
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to purchasing delivery of specific programmes and providing advice and support that enhances the role of parents/caregivers in the development of their children and promotes the value of quality education experiences.

Ministry of Education.name: Home Schooling Allowances
Ministry of Education.scope: Provides an allowance payable to parents/caregivers of children in full-time correspondence programmes for primary and secondary education and to parents/caregivers of children receiving their primary and secondary education at home (where a certificate of exemption from enrolment has been approved under section 21 of the Education Act 1989).

Ministry of Education.name: Property Disposal Incentives Scheme
Ministry of Education.scope: Payments to schools of a share of the proceeds from the sale of their surplus school property assets.

Ministry of Education.name: Quality Assurance
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision by the New Zealand Qualifications Authority of quality assurance services to support the New Zealand qualifications system that include ongoing development and management of quality assurance processes, monitoring and managing providers at risk and the ongoing refinement and maintenance of the quality assurance framework.

Ministry of Education.name: Tertiary Education and Training Advice
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing advice and support to Ministers on the tertiary sector and tertiary education and training issues.

Ministry of Education.name: Scholarships for Students to Attend Private Schools
Ministry of Education.scope: Assistance to students from low-income families to attend private secondary schools.

Ministry of Education.name: Mapihi Pounamu
Ministry of Education.scope: Assistance to at-risk students enrolled in school level Year 9 and above, who face barriers to learning, to ensure they participate and achieve in education.  The scheme is administered by the Ministry of Education.

Ministry of Education.name: Education Research Initiatives
Ministry of Education.scope: Purchase of research about teaching and learning in our educational institutions and independent research on education issues, policies and practices.

Ministry of Education.name: Ownership Monitoring of Tertiary Education Institutions
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to monitoring and advisory services - including interventions - on the Government's ownership interest in tertiary education institutions.

Ministry of Education.name: Tertiary Education Institutions Merger Support
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing support toward the additional costs related to the merger of particular tertiary education institutions.

Ministry of Education.name: UNESCO
Ministry of Education.scope: Annual membership contribution to United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation's international administration, and a programme of activities of the National Commission, including participation in regional and international activities.

Ministry of Education.name: Service Academies
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing military-focused programmes for disengaged or disengaging senior students in secondary schools.

Ministry of Education.name: School Support Project
Ministry of Education.scope: Capital costs of implementing approved school support and schooling improvement projects (other than costs related to school property assets).

Ministry of Education.name: International Student Scholarship Scheme
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to scholarships available to international students wishing to study in New Zealand.  Details of the criteria and selection process for the scheme are available from Education New Zealand.

Ministry of Education.name: Study Abroad Awards
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to awards granted to provide assistance to top scholars, researchers and teachers to undertake placements abroad and to participate in reciprocal education exchange arrangements with partner countries in selected areas of priority study, teaching and research.  The criteria and selection process are available from Education New Zealand and AFS Intercultural Programmes New Zealand.

Ministry of Education.name: Remission of Fees
Ministry of Education.scope: Payment to the New Zealand Qualifications Authority for student examination fees remitted in cases of hardship.

Ministry of Education.name: Auckland University Starpath Project
Ministry of Education.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding to support the Starpath initiatives at the University of Auckland.

Ministry of Education.name: School Transport Bus Controllers
Ministry of Education.scope: Payments to teachers who, as bus controllers, assist in the provision of school transport assistance.

Ministry of Education.name: Interest Subsidy for Schools
Ministry of Education.scope: Provides a subsidy on interest payments for borrowing by private and State integrated schools for approved property-related projects.  Administration costs are also included.

Ministry of Education.name: New Zealand Teachers Council
Ministry of Education.scope: Operating grant to assist the Teachers Council to carry out its leadership function.

Ministry of Education.name: United World Scholarships
Ministry of Education.scope: Scholarships for attendance at United World Colleges.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Pacific Development Assistance
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to provision of assistance for development activities for Pacific Island countries. The assistance will be provided to development organisations, partner countries and through other delivery mechanisms; and be used to implement activities that include humanitarian assistance; design, management, implementation and evaluation of those partner-led activities. The assistance is to be consistent with Ministers' requirement for NZAID to work with development partners to ensure aid expenditure is targeted as close as possible to need.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Policy Advice and Representation - Other Countries
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to meeting the costs, as set out in section 11 of the Foreign Affairs Act 1988, of superannuation for local staff employed by overseas posts to help with the management of New Zealand's foreign and trade relations with other countries.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Global Development Assistance
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to provision of assistance for development activities for non Pacific Island countries including Asian, African, Latin American, Caribbean, and Middle Eastern countries. The assistance will be provided to development organisations, partner countries and through other delivery mechanisms and be used to implement activities that include humanitarian assistance; design, management, implementation and evaluation of those partner-led activities. The assistance is to be consistent with Ministers' requirement for NZAID to work with development partners to ensure aid expenditure is targeted as close as possible to need.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: International Agency Funding
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: Contributions to international agencies for multilateral humanitarian and development policy and programme activity.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade - Capital Expenditure
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Policy Advice and Representation - International Institutions
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: The purchase of policy advice and representation activities related to the management of New Zealand's membership of, and foreign and trade interests in, international institutions.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Management of New Zealand Official Development Assistance
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to advice and representation on international development issues and the management of the New Zealand Official Development Assistance (ODA) programme.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Subscriptions to International Organisations
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to non-discretionary payments required as formal obligations arising from New Zealand's membership of international organisations, and as a signatory to international treaties and conventions.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: New Zealand Voluntary Agency Grants
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: Contributions to non-government organisations providing humanitarian and development assistance overseas, conducting development education within New Zealand and providing capacity building and co-ordination support to New Zealand NGOs.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Consular Services
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: The purchase of consular policy advice, consular services for New Zealanders abroad and notarial services.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Services for Other New Zealand Agencies Overseas
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: The purchase of accommodation and support services by other New Zealand agencies.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Antarctic Research and Support
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: Provision of management and logistic support for New Zealand activities in the Antarctic. The provider is the New Zealand Antarctic Institute.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Rugby World Cup: Guest of Government
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of services to fund the cost of hosting Guests of Government attending the Rugby World Cup.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Hosting of Pacific Islands Forum Meeting
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of services to fund the hosting of the Pacific Islands Forum meeting in Auckland in September 2011.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Promotion of Asian Skills and Relationships
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of services that build and sustain New Zealanders' knowledge and understanding of and relationships with Asia.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Pacific Security Fund
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: The purchase of activities and equipment to enhance Pacific Islands security that mutually reinforce New Zealand's security interests.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Administration of Diplomatic Privileges and Immunities
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: This appropriation is limited to the administration of diplomatic and consular privileges and immunities under the Diplomatic Privileges and Immunities Act 1968 and the Consular Privileges and Immunities Act 1971.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Pacific Cooperation Foundation
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: The promotion of mutual understanding and constructive linkages between New Zealanders and the other countries and people of the Pacific. The provider is the Pacific Cooperation Foundation of New Zealand.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Disbursements Made and Exemptions from Taxation
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: Refund of New Zealand local body rates for offices and residential premises of overseas diplomatic missions and consular posts pursuant to section 21 of the Diplomatic Privileges and Immunities Act 1968.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.name: Promotional Activities - Other Countries
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.scope: The purchase of promoting New Zealand to other countries as an attractive market for trade and investment.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Waitemata DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Waitemata DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Canterbury DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Canterbury DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Counties-Manukau DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Counties-Manukau DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: National Disability Support Services
Ministry of Health.scope: Delivery of disability support services provided through DHBs and third-party service providers.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Auckland DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Auckland DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Waikato DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Waikato DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Southern DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Southern DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Capital and Coast DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Capital and Coast DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Bay of Plenty DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Bay of Plenty DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Public Health Service Purchasing
Ministry of Health.scope: Public Health Services funded by the Ministry of Health from DHBs and other public health service providers.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Northland DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Northland DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - MidCentral DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from MidCentral DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Hawkes Bay DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Hawkes Bay DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Equity for Capital Projects for DHBs and Health Sector Crown Agencies
Ministry of Health.scope: Capital contributions to District Health Boards and health sector Crown agencies to cover new investments and reconfiguration of their balance sheets.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Nelson-Marlborough DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Nelson-Marlborough DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Hutt DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Hutt DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Taranaki DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Taranaki DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Lakes DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Lakes DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: National Elective Services
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding for the purchase of additional elective surgery services.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Whanganui DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Whanganui DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Primary Health Care Strategy
Ministry of Health.scope: This appropriation is limited to services to implement and deliver the Primary Health Care Strategy.

Ministry of Health.name: Health Services Funding
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding to respond to emerging health sector risks, provision for DHB structural deficit support, and contingency funding for Government priority health policy initiatives.

Ministry of Health.name: Health Workforce Training and Development
Ministry of Health.scope: Provision of clinical training for doctors, nurses, dentists and other health professionals.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - South Canterbury DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from South Canterbury DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: National Maternity Services
Ministry of Health.scope: For the funding and purchase of maternity services directly by the Crown.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Tairawhiti DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Tairawhiti DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - West Coast DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from West Coast DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: Health and Disability Support Services - Wairarapa DHB
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding of personal and mental health services including services for the health of older people, provision of hospital and related services and management outputs from Wairarapa DHB.

Ministry of Health.name: National Contracted Services - Other
Ministry of Health.scope: For the funding and purchase of other health services including mobile surgical services, telephone advice services, sexual and reproductive health services, and services associated with the implementation of the Oral Health and Cancer Control Strategies.

Ministry of Health.name: National Emergency Services
Ministry of Health.scope: For the funding and purchase of health emergency services directly by the Crown.

Ministry of Health.name: National Mental Health Services
Ministry of Health.scope: For the funding and purchase of mental health services directly by the Crown.

Ministry of Health.name: National Child Health Services
Ministry of Health.scope: For the funding and purchase of child health services directly by the Crown.

Ministry of Health.name: Loans for Capital Projects
Ministry of Health.scope: Provision of new loans to DHBs for the purpose of facilities redevelopment and other purposes agreed by the Crown including balance sheet reconfiguration.

Ministry of Health.name: Health Sector Information Systems
Ministry of Health.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of information technology services and the publication of data derived from these services to the health and disability system.

Ministry of Health.name: Regulatory and Enforcement Services
Ministry of Health.scope: This appropriation is limited to implementing, enforcing and administering health- and disability-related legislation and regulations, and provision of regulatory advice to the sector and to Ministers, and support services for committees established under statute or appointed by the Minister pursuant to legislation.

Ministry of Health.name: Policy Advice
Ministry of Health.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of policy advice and ministerial servicing that relates to the health and disability system, including the provision of advice and information to the public and other agencies on health and disability policy issues.

Ministry of Health.name: Sector Planning and Performance
Ministry of Health.scope: This appropriation is limited to advising on and co-ordinating health sector planning and performance improvement; and funding, monitoring, and supporting the governance of, health sector Crown entities, and sector co-ordination.

Ministry of Health.name: Managing the Purchase of Services
Ministry of Health.scope: This appropriation is limited to purchasing services for the public and health and disability sector on behalf of the Crown, for those services where the Ministry has responsibility for the purchasing function (i.e. funding is not devolved to another entity).

Ministry of Health.name: Provider Development
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding support and provide assistance for the development of the third party health service workforce, in particular, Maori and Pacific people's providers.

Ministry of Health.name: Payment Services
Ministry of Health.scope: This output class is limited to the administration and audit of contracts and payments on behalf of the Crown and Crown agencies.

Ministry of Health.name: Ministry of Health - Capital Expenditure
Ministry of Health.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Ministry of Health, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Ministry of Health.name: Problem Gambling Services
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding to support the research and implementation of strategies to prevent and minimise the harm from gambling, and for the provision of treatment services to problem gamblers and assistance to their families and whanau in accordance with the Gambling Act 2003.

Ministry of Health.name: Monitoring and Protecting Health and Disability Consumer Interests
Ministry of Health.scope: Provision of services to monitor and protect health consumer interests by the Health and Disability Commissioner, District Mental Health Inspectors and Review Tribunals, and the Mental Health Commission.

Ministry of Health.name: Residential Care Loans
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding to provide interest-free loans to people entering into aged residential care facilities.

Ministry of Health.name: National Maori Health Services
Ministry of Health.scope: For the funding and purchase of  Maori health services directly by the Crown.

Ministry of Health.name: Health Sector Projects
Ministry of Health.scope: Capital investment in specific health sector assets.

Ministry of Health.name: International Health Organisations
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding for New Zealand's membership to the World Health Organisation (WHO), and the contribution to specific WHO projects.

Ministry of Health.name: Crown Health Financing Agency
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding for Crown Health Financing Agency (CHFA) to provide and manage the Crown term debt facilities for DHBs, provide independent advice to the Minister on the credit worthiness and financial sustainability of DHBs, and to manage residual area health board liabilities.

Ministry of Health.name: Legal Expenses
Ministry of Health.scope: Funding for the defence and settlement of legal claims against the Crown.

Ministry of Health.name: National Advisory and Support Services
Ministry of Health.scope: Provision of advisory and support services by independent service providers.

Ministry of Justice.name: Historical Treaty of Waitangi Settlements 2009 – 2013
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to settlement of historical Treaty of Waitangi claims, including redress through the transfer of assets (cash and property) from the Crown to claimant groups, any simple interest payable on settlements between the date specified in the Deed of Settlement and the Settlement Date, and payment of claimant funding.

Ministry of Justice.name: District Court Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: Provision of services in regard to the work of the District Courts, including the Youth Court and Family Court.

Ministry of Justice.name: Legal Aid
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the payments of legal aid to approved providers.

Ministry of Justice.name: Judges' Salaries and Allowances
Ministry of Justice.scope: Costs related to the terms and conditions of remuneration for Judges and acting warranted Judges in the Supreme Court, Court of Appeal, High Court, District Court, Employment Court and Maori Land Court incurred pursuant to s.9A Judicature Act 1908, s.6 District Courts Act 1948 and s.13 Te Ture Whenua Maori Land Act 1993.

Ministry of Justice.name: Ministry of Justice - Capital Expenditure
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Ministry of Justice, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Ministry of Justice.name: Specialist Courts, Tribunals and Other Authorities Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: Provision of services in regard to the work of the Environment Court, Employment Court, Maori Land Court, Maori Appellate Court, Disputes Tribunals, Tenancy Tribunal, Liquor Licensing Authority, Coroners and a range of tribunals and other authorities.  This output class also includes services to Maori landowners and contracting mortuary services as part of supporting the work of Coroners.

Ministry of Justice.name: Collection and Enforcement of Fines and Civil Debts Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: Purchase of collection and enforcement of fines and civil debts services.

Ministry of Justice.name: Higher Court Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: Provision of services in regard to the work of the Supreme Court, Court of Appeal and High Court.

Ministry of Justice.name: Impairment of Fines Receivable
Ministry of Justice.scope: Allowance for the impairment of fines and enforcement fees including the assessment of future fines remittals; the discounting to present value; expected collection costs and other elements in determining fair value.

Ministry of Justice.name: Family Court Professional Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: Services provided by Court appointed counsel and specialists in relation to custody and access matters and matrimonial disputes, including those made under provisions of the Care of Children Act 2004.

Ministry of Justice.name: Provision of Services from the Electoral Commission
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to fund services relating to the administration of parliamentary elections and referenda, servicing the work of the Representation Commission, and the provision of advice, reports and public education on electoral matters.

Ministry of Justice.name: Policy Advice
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to policy advice, legal advice and research and evaluation in relation to civil, criminal and constitutional law, foreshore and seabed policy and treaty negotiation advice and providing agreed services to the Minister of Justice, Minister for Courts and Minister for Treaty of Waitangi Negotiations.

Ministry of Justice.name: Impairment of Legal Aid Debt
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the impairment of legal aid debt including assessment of future write-offs and other elements in determining fair value.

Ministry of Justice.name: Producing and Maintaining Electoral Rolls
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding the Electoral Enrolment Centre (New Zealand Post Ltd), for services relating to the maintenance of electoral rolls, including all activities required to register electors and produce electoral rolls as required by law.

Ministry of Justice.name: Policy Advice - Treaty Negotiations
Ministry of Justice.scope: Advice on generic Treaty issues and specific historical Treaty claims. Negotiation of historical Treaty claims.  Where appropriate, the preparation of settlement legislation, property valuation, disclosure and preparation and execution of legal documentation required to enable the transfer of settlement assets to claimants.

Ministry of Justice.name: Administration of Legal Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the administration of legal services including legal aid and related schemes; and the management and collection of legal aid debt.

Ministry of Justice.name: Equity Promotion and Protection Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding the following; Human Rights Commission to advocate and promote respect for, and an understanding and appreciation of, human rights in New Zealand, and encourage the maintenance and development of harmonious relations between individuals and among the diverse groups in New Zealand society; Independent Police Conduct Authority to investigate incidents and investigate and resolve complaints against the Police, and to uphold the rights of persons in Police detention; Privacy Commissioner on privacy issues relating to the collection and disclosure of personal information and the privacy of individuals and Inspector-General of Intelligence and Security to fund administrative support .

Ministry of Justice.name: Domestic Violence Professional Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: Court appointed counsel and programme providers in relation to the Domestic Violence Act 1995 or referrals for programmes from criminal courts dealing with domestic violence cases.

Ministry of Justice.name: Public Defence Service
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of representation for defendants in criminal cases at specified courts.

Ministry of Justice.name: Land, Stock, Plant Purchases
Ministry of Justice.scope: The purchase of surplus Crown property is held in the Office of Treaty Settlements Landbank to protect it for possible use in future Treaty of Waitangi settlements.

Ministry of Justice.name: Community Law Centres
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding programmes to support Community Law Centres.

Ministry of Justice.name: Waitangi Tribunal Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: Purchase of research and administrative services related to the management of claims through the Waitangi Tribunal.

Ministry of Justice.name: Claimant Funding
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to payment of claimant funding related to the settlement of historical Treaty of Waitangi claims.

Ministry of Justice.name: Children Young Persons and Their Families Professional Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: Counsel and specialists providing services and reports as directed by the court in relation to care and protection orders under the Children, Young Persons and Their Families Act 1989.

Ministry of Justice.name: Property Portfolio Management
Ministry of Justice.scope: Management, transfer and disposal of Crown-owned property for Treaty settlement purposes.

Ministry of Justice.name: Administrative Assistance for Foreshore and Seabed Arrangements
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding the implementation and ongoing exercise of any functions by nga hapu a Ngati Porou and Te Whanau a Apanui recognised under Foreshore and Seabed Deeds of Agreement.

Ministry of Justice.name: Crime Prevention and Community Safety Programmes
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the funding of programmes delivered by non government organisations and local government agencies to prevent and reduce crime.

Ministry of Justice.name: Sector Leadership and Support
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to advice and services focused on the Ministry’s leadership role in the justice sector. This covers enhancing the Ministry’s coordination with other sector and Government agencies, advice and information about judicial and statutory appointments and monitoring specific crown entities.

Ministry of Justice.name: Youth Court Professional Fees
Ministry of Justice.scope: Payments to court appointed counsel and specialists providing reports as directed in the Youth Court.

Ministry of Justice.name: Coroner-Directed Post-Mortems
Ministry of Justice.scope: Cost of pathology services and mortuary facilities for coroner-directed post-mortems.

Ministry of Justice.name: Support and Assistance provided by Victim Support to Victims of Crime
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of services from the New Zealand Council of Victim Support Groups (“Victim Support”) for the provision of services to victims of crime and trauma. This covers personalised support services (covering 24 hour emergency support and follow up support through the criminal justice system) and the administration of victim assistance schemes (covering counselling for families of homicide victims, and financial assistance to help victims).

Ministry of Justice.name: Abortion Supervisory Committee - Certifying Consultants Fees
Ministry of Justice.scope: Payments to certifying consultants for providing opinions under Section 33 of the Contraception, Sterilisation and Abortion Act 1977.

Ministry of Justice.name: Tribunal Members Fees and Expenses
Ministry of Justice.scope: Fees for the Chairs and Members of Specialist Tribunals, and expenses incurred by those Chairs and members in relation to Tribunal work.

Ministry of Justice.name: Provision of Protective Fiduciary Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of fiduciary services provided by the Public Trust as specified by statute where charges to the recipient, if any, will not meet the costs of the service.

Ministry of Justice.name: Coroners Salaries and Allowances
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the costs related to the terms and conditions of remuneration for Coroners pursuant to Section 110 of the Coroners Act 2006.

Ministry of Justice.name: Advice from the Law Commission
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding the Law Commission for advice on the review, reform and development of all aspects of the law in New Zealand.

Ministry of Justice.name: Depreciation
Ministry of Justice.scope: Depreciation on assets held in the Office of Treaty Settlements Landbank for Treaty settlements.

Ministry of Justice.name: Medical and Other Professional Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: Funding for medical and other professional services as required by legislation.

Ministry of Justice.name: Witness Fees and Expenses
Ministry of Justice.scope: Payments to ordinary and expert witnesses appearing in criminal jury trials.

Ministry of Justice.name: Representation - Waitangi Tribunal
Ministry of Justice.scope: Allows the Crown to undertake research into historical Treaty grievances and ensures the Crown is represented with well prepared documentation and evidence at Waitangi Tribunal hearings.

Ministry of Justice.name: Provision of Services from the Electoral Commission - Broadcasting
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding to enable political parties to meet all or part of the cost of broadcasting election programmes.  The appropriation for election broadcasting is a permanent legislative authority established under section 74 of the Broadcasting Act 1989.

Ministry of Justice.name: Victims' Services
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of funding for entitlements and services for victims of crime.

Ministry of Justice.name: Impairment of Offender Levy
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to allowances for the impairment of the Offender Levy including assessment of future remittals and other elements in determining fair value.

Ministry of Justice.name: Crime Prevention and Community Safety
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to provision of services and advice (excluding policy advice) focused on assisting local authorities and communities to develop crime prevention and community safety programmes.

Ministry of Justice.name: Personal Property Protection Rights Costs
Ministry of Justice.scope: Payments to service providers appointed by the court under the Protection of Personal and Property Rights Act 1988.

Ministry of Justice.name: Contribution toward all Foreshore and Seabed Negotiation Costs
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to contributions toward negotiations on customary rights and interests in the foreshore and seabed areas for all coastal iwi.

Ministry of Justice.name: Judicial Review Costs
Ministry of Justice.scope: Cost of legal services (including settlement of claims) in cases involving the exercise of judicial functions or the execution of judicial process or costs of counsel to assist the court, including payments ordered to be made from the Maori Land Court Special Aid Fund.

Ministry of Justice.name: Justices of the Peace Association
Ministry of Justice.scope: Cost of administrative services from the Royal Federation of Justices to roster Justices of the Peace for court hearings.

Ministry of Justice.name: MVDT Adjudicator Remuneration and Assessors Costs
Ministry of Justice.scope: Remuneration paid to adjudicators and fees and allowances paid to assessors of the Motor Vehicle Disputes Tribunal (MVDT).

Ministry of Justice.name: Visiting Justices to Prisons
Ministry of Justice.scope: To meet fees and expenses for Senior Counsel and Justices of the Peace appointed as Visiting Justices to prisons.

Ministry of Justice.name: Costs in Criminal Cases
Ministry of Justice.scope: Costs awarded to defendants by a court under the Costs in Criminal Cases Act 1967.

Ministry of Justice.name: Equity Promotion and Protection Services - Inspector General
Ministry of Justice.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding the Inspector-General as per the provisions of the Permanent Legislative Authority contained in section 8 of the Inspector-General of Intelligence and Security Act 1996.

Ministry of Justice.name: Debt Write-offs
Ministry of Justice.scope: Write-off of Bad Debts from Landbank rental properties.

Ministry of Justice.name: Coroner Related Fees and Expenses
Ministry of Justice.scope: Payments to Coroners for the performance of their judicial responsibilities.

Ministry of Justice.name: Assistance to Victims of Crime
Ministry of Justice.scope: Funding for the Criminal Justice Assistance Reimbursement Scheme.

Ministry of Justice.name: Representations for Blood Sampling
Ministry of Justice.scope: Cost of representation for parties (aged under 17) appearing before the court with regard to providing blood samples in criminal investigations.

Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.name: Policy, Communications and Relationships
Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing information, policy advice, nominations services, and the establishment and maintenance of relationships with Pacific communities, to improve outcomes for Pacific Peoples in New Zealand, as well as ministerial servicing.

Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.name: Promotions - Business Development
Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.scope: This output class involves the purchase of a range of services that will provide opportunities for Pacific peoples to gain the information and skills necessary to succeed in business.

Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.name: Skills Training and Employment
Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of services from third party providers to support improved education, skill development, and entrepreneurship of Pacific peoples in Auckland.

Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.name: Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs - Capital Expenditure
Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.name: Study and Training Awards for Business Development
Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.scope: This is for the promotion of positive role models for young Pacific people in New Zealand and the provision of scholarships for further education.

Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.name: Welfare of Pacific Island People in New Zealand
Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.scope: This provides scholarships and seeding grants for projects with objectives falling within the strategic areas identified for the Ministry of Pacific Island Affairs.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Crown Research Institute Core Funding
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to Crown Research Institutes to create and maintain capability that is required for their core purpose and strategy.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: High Value Manufacturing and Services Research
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to research and research applications to develop new technologies, novel materials, and new products, processes and services for the manufacturing and technology sectors.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Biological Industries Research
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to research and research applications to support productivity growth and sustainability of New Zealand’s primary industries, and the development of premium food and industrial biological products and technologies responsive to global consumer preferences.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Health and Society Research
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to research and research applications to improve the health and social well-being of New Zealanders.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Marsden Fund
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to excellent investigator-initiated research.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Environmental Research
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to research and research applications to underpin the management, protection and enhancement of natural ecosystems, land and freshwater resources, climate and atmosphere within New Zealand, including Antarctica.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Science and Innovation Contract Management
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This output class is limited to contract management, planning, monitoring and evaluating science and innovation outputs and impacts.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Strategic Leadership in the Science and Innovation Sector
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This output class is limited to policy advice, ministerial services and leadership of the science and innovation sector.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Hazards and Infrastructure Research
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to research and research applications to support hazard management and improve the durability of NZ urban and rural settlements.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Energy and Minerals Research
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to research and research applications to improve mineral extraction, improve energy security and to obtain efficient and affordable energy use.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Fellowships for Excellence
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to encouraging the career development of the country’s talented early and mid-career researchers.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: International Relationships
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to grants for international research relationships.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Engaging New Zealanders with Science and Technology
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to engaging New Zealanders with science and technology through approaches determined by the Minister.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: National eScience Infrastructure
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to a grant to contribute to the operation of the National eScience Infrastructure, including high-performance computational infrastructure and associated eScience services, that will support New Zealand research.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Research Contract Management
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to selection of research, science and technology-related organisations and individuals for either the provision of research, science and technology outputs, or the award of grants; and negotiate, manage and monitor appropriate contracts with those organisations or individuals.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Vision Matauranga Capability Fund
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the development of skilled people and organisations undertaking research that supports the four themes of Vision Matauranga; indigenous innovation, environmental sustainability, health and social well being, and exploring indigenous knowledge.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: National Measurement Standards
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing specified standards to satisfy the needs for traceable physical measurement in New Zealand.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Genomics Research Infrastructure
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to a grant to contribute towards the purchase and operation of infrastructure that will support genomics research.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Science Collections and Infrastructure
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to grants to contribute to the maintenance and retention of databases, collections and significant infrastructure dedicated to research purposes.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Ministry of Science and Innovation - Capital Expenditure
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Ministry of Science and Innovation, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Cross Agency Research
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to research to assist policy development for the achievement of Government priorities.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Royal Society of New Zealand
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to an annual grant to the Royal Society of New Zealand to contribute towards the Society’s aims and functions under the Royal Society of New Zealand Act 1997 to promote and advance science and technology.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Advanced Network Capability Building
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to a grant for the development of capability within the Advanced Network user group (including Tertiary Education Institutes and Crown Research Institutes) to make effective use of the Kiwi Advanced Research and Education Network.

Ministry of Science and Innovation.name: Convention Du Metre
Ministry of Science and Innovation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the payment of New Zealand's annual subscription to the Convention du Metre.

Ministry of Social Development.name: New Zealand Superannuation
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of an income for people who have reached the qualifying age of 65 years and fulfil the residency requirements, as provided for in the New Zealand Superannuation and Retirement Income Act 2001.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Domestic Purposes Benefit
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of income support for sole parents, caregivers of sick or infirm people or women alone, whose domestic circumstances exclude them from fully participating in the labour force. Paid in accordance with criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964.
