Ministry of Social Development.name: Student Loans
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to loans to tertiary students undertaking studies at approved tertiary institutions in accordance with Cabinet decisions.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Invalid's Benefit
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of means-tested income support for people who are totally blind, or permanently and severely restricted in their capacity for work due to sickness, injury or disability. Paid in accordance with the criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Accommodation Assistance
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the Accommodation Supplement, Special Transfer Allowance, and Away From Home Allowance to persons to cover accommodation costs, paid in accordance with the criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964 and delegated legislation issued under that Act.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Unemployment Benefit and Emergency Benefit
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of means-tested assistance for people who are not in full-time employment and are available for and seeking full time employment, or engaged in approved activities. Also the provision of assistance to people who are in hardship and unable to earn enough income for themselves (and any dependent family) and cannot receive another benefit. Both forms of assistance are paid in accordance with criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964 and delegated legislation issued under that Act.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Sickness Benefit
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of means-tested income support for people who are not in full-time employment and are limited in their capacity for work, or who are in employment but working at a reduced level, because of sickness, injury, disability or pregnancy. Paid in accordance with the criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Student Allowances
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to means-tested allowances for students on an approved study programme in accordance with the criteria established by the Student Allowance Regulations 1998; and payment of Student Allowance Transfer Grants to students with dependants in accordance with the criteria established by delegated legislation issued under the Social Security Act 1964.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Debt Write-downs
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision for write-downs of Crown debt administered by the Ministry of Social Development due to debt write offs or debt provisions resulting from the need to value debt in accordance with generally accepted accounting practice.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Disability Assistance
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the Disability Allowance to persons with disability costs and the Child Disability Allowance to the caregivers of children with a serious disability, paid in accordance with the criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964 and delegated legislation issued under that Act.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Tailored Sets of Services to Help People into Work or Achieve Independence
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to delivering tailored sets of services to individuals to help them into sustainable employment, participate more fully in their community or achieve a greater level of social independence; and the management of related non-departmental output contracts.  The composition of each set of services is determined by the individual’s needs and selected from a mix of employment readiness training and support, employment placement, social support services, payment of income support and training support benefits, and referrals to other employment or social support providers.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Care and Protection Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Social work services, both statutory and informal, that protect and assist children and young people who are in need of care and protection.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Hardship Assistance
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to Civil Defence payments, Funeral Grants, Live Organ Donors Assistance, Special Benefit, Special Needs Grants and Temporary Additional Support to provide means-tested temporary financial assistance to persons with emergency or essential costs, paid in accordance with the criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964 and delegated legislation issued under that Act.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Childcare Assistance
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of assistance for the costs of childcare that meets specific quality guidelines, where parents meet activity and income criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964 and delegated legislation issued under that Act.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Veterans' Pension
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of income support for ex-service people who served in a declared war or emergency and who have either reached the qualifying age for New Zealand Superannuation and are on a 70% (or greater) War Disablement Pension, or are prevented from undertaking employment for a substantial period due to disability and who fulfill the New Zealand citizenship and residency requirements as set out in the War Pensions Act 1954.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Recoverable Assistance
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Facility for low-income earners and beneficiaries to access means-tested assistance to enable them to meet essential and immediate needs, or costs in specific circumstances. Criteria are set out in relevant Welfare Programmes and Ministerial Directions pursuant to the Social Security Act 1964.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Youth Justice Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Social work and other services to manage and resolve offending behaviour by children and young people, by providing assessment, support, programmes, containment and care of young offenders.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Employment Assistance
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of assistance to help address barriers faced by job seekers so they can become work ready, move into employment and stay in employment for longer periods of time. This employment assistance is governed by the Cabinet and Ministerial Guidelines for Employment and Training Assistance.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Strong Families
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Purchase of services to improve outcomes for families and their members. These services aim to support vulnerable families with a focus on prevention and early intervention.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Orphan's/Unsupported Child's Benefit
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of income support for people charged with the responsibility for the care of a child whose parents are dead or cannot be located, or suffer a serious long-term disablement that renders them unable to care for the child, or where there has been a breakdown in the child’s family.  Paid in accordance with criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Vocational Services for People with Disabilities
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of vocational services for people with disabilities including community participation and employment services.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Widow's Benefit
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of means-tested income support for women whose partners have died and who do not yet qualify for New Zealand Superannuation, but meet residency and other requirements. Paid in accordance with criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Family Wellbeing Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Purchase of services that aim to improve the life outcomes for children, young people and families through support and development programmes, and programmes that will prevent any future harm or abuse.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Ministry of Social Development - Capital Expenditure
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Ministry of Social Development, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Vocational Skills Training
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to vocationally based skills training for working-age people through the Training Opportunities Programme.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Social Policy Advice
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This output class is limited to policy advice and servicing support comprising advice on cross-sectoral and long term social policy matters; advice on the design and operation of social development programmes and initiatives; the provision of information to, and discussion fora for, the public and other agencies on social policy issues; and ministerial servicing.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Benefits Paid in Australia
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Reimbursement to the Australian Government for income support assistance provided to New Zealanders eligible under the 1994 Reciprocal Agreement, which was terminated for new entrants on 1 July 2002. From 1 July 2002 the Social Welfare (Reciprocity with Australia) Order 2002 came into force, with payments now reflecting pre-agreed amounts in Australian currency before adjusting for annual inflation.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Income Support and Assistance to Seniors
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to paying New Zealand Superannuation and social security entitlements (including administering related international social security agreements) and providing advice to help older people maintain independence and social participation; and administering international social security agreements relating to non-superannuitants; and assessing financial entitlement to residential Care Subsidies.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Services to Protect the Integrity of the Benefit System
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Services to minimise errors, fraud and abuse of the benefit system.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Family and Community Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of leadership and co-ordination services to support and strengthen families and whanau; including providing information and advice that assists families, young people and communities and managing preventative social services programmes.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Study Scholarships and Awards
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to scholarships and awards to tertiary students awarded in accordance with Cabinet decisions; and Teach NZ Scholarships awarded in accordance with the Education Act 1989.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Transition to Work
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of payments to beneficiaries, low income earners, students and ex beneficiaries, who meet certain criteria, to assist in the transition from benefit to employment and the continuation of employment. Criteria are set out in relevant Welfare Programmes and Ministerial Directions pursuant to the Social Security Act 1964.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Management of Student Support, excluding Student Loans
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to managing non-recoverable financial support to students, involving assessing and paying student allowances and other income support to eligible secondary and tertiary students.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Counselling and Rehabilitation Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Purchase of services, including family counselling and other post-crisis interventions that restore the wellbeing of children, young people and families who have suffered harm and abuse or other forms of family breakdown or youth justice issues.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Out of School Care Programmes
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of assistance to CYF approved OSCAR programmes to assist with the establishment and/or operating costs of OSCAR programmes.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Connected Communities
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Funding of services that strengthen and support communities and community functioning, and which assist communities to support families in improving their family circumstances.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Employment Related Training Assistance
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of assistance with costs of undertaking approved employment related training, which is paid in accordance with the criteria set out in delegated legislation under the Social Security Act 1964.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Collection of Balances Owed by Former Clients and Non-beneficiaries
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Services to manage the collection of overpayments and recoverable assistance loans from former clients and other balances owed comprising of Student Allowance overpayments, Liable Parent Contributions, and court ordered Maintenance.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Management of Student Loans
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to assessing and paying student loans to eligible tertiary students, and as part of managing this support, providing related guidance to students making financial and study decisions.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Independent Youth Benefit
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of income support for people aged 16 or 17 years who are currently unemployed but actively seeking work, training for work, at school, or sick, injured or disabled, where it is inappropriate for them to obtain financial support from their parents.  Paid in accordance with criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Special Circumstance Assistance
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to financial assistance to people in special circumstances and comprises the Clothing Allowance, and providing assistance for community costs, domestic violence and witness protection relocation, home help, social rehabilitation assistance, telephone costs paid in accordance with criteria set out in the Social Security Act 1964, and delegated legislation under that Act; and Civilian Amputees Assistance, paid in accordance with criteria set out in the Disabled Persons Community Welfare Act 1975.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Youth Transition Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of transition support, further training, education and employment activities for all school leavers aged 15 to 20 years.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Adoption Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: The management of services, incorporating education, assessment, reporting, counselling, and mediation, to all people who are party to adoption-related matters, past or present.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Education and Prevention Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Purchase of education and prevention programmes and initiatives that aim to provide skills to children, young people and families who are at risk of harm or abuse, which will help them reduce the risk of that abuse or harm.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Development and Funding of Community Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Management of Government funding of community-based social and welfare services.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Families Commission
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of services from the Families Commission to promote the wellbeing of a full range of New Zealand families and whänau through undertaking research and evidence gathering to build a transfer of knowledge to policymakers and purchasers and providers of services.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Services for Young People
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of programmes and services to enable the implementation of the Youth Development Strategy Aotearoa at a regional and local level.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Administration of Community Services Card
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This output class is limited to assessing entitlement, issuing cards, and promoting and distributing information about the Community Services Card.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Youth Development
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Leadership and provision of policy advice and service delivery to improve outcomes for young people.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Prevention Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Education and advice services for the prevention of child abuse and neglect, and the promotion of the wellbeing of children, young people and their families.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Mainstream Supported Employment Programme
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to salary subsidies, training for participants, supervisors and placement specialists, and funding for other employment support provided by the Mainstream Supported Employment Programme.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Student Placement Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of placement services for students for holiday and term employment.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Strengthening Providers and Communities
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Purchase of services that contribute to strengthening the capacity and capability of providers to deliver strong and effective social services.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Children's Commissioner
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of services from the Children's Commissioner including the discharge of the Commissioner's duties under the Children's Commissioner Act 2003, monitoring and reporting on services delivered under the Children, Young Persons, and Their Families Act, 1989, and the identification of aspects of law, policy and practice that might adversely affect children and the development and proposal of remedies.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Trialling New Approaches to Social Sector Change
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the delivery of social sector services for young people in specified locations and, in those locations where that delivery is led by non-governmental organisation, to the administration of that delivery.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Assistance to Disadvantaged Persons
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of resources and assistance to disadvantaged and disabled people in the community and comprises: distribution of talking books and articles for the blind; advocacy assistance to people seeking entitlements from government agencies; and supporting and promoting the development of more houses accessible by disabled and older people.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Management of SuperGold Card
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This output class is limited to management of the SuperGold Card and the Veteran SuperGold Card comprising assessing entitlement for, and issuing cards, distributing information about the Card, enlisting business partners to provide discounts to cardholders, and promoting use of the Card and related discounts.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Promoting Positive Outcomes for Disabled People
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to promoting positive outcomes for disabled people and comprises of: enabling the involvement of disabled people in the monitoring and implementation of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Disabled Persons; and changing negative attitudes towards disabled people.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Senior Citizens Services
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of policy advice to protect the rights and interests of older people and their wellbeing.  It also includes ministerial services and support for local community involvement in senior citizens' issues.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Youth Development Partnership Fund
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Provision of one-off partial funding, to assist Territorial Authorities to respond to the emerging needs and opportunities for young people.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Family Start/NGO Awards
Ministry of Social Development.scope: Payment of course fees for Family Start family/whanau and NGO workers pursuing social work qualifications.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Processing and Payment of Veterans' Pensions
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the processing and payment of Veterans' Pensions and related allowances.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Administration of Trialling New Approaches to Social Sector Change
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the administration by committed individuals of the delivery of social sector services for young people in specified locations.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Crown Entity Monitoring
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This output class is limited to the purchase, appointment and monitoring advice for social development and employment Crown entities, and appointment advice for social development and employment statutory tribunals.

Ministry of Social Development.name: Property Management Centre of Expertise
Ministry of Social Development.scope: This appropriation is limited to the operation of a Property Management Centre of Expertise, to provide guidance, support, and monitoring in respect of property management within the Public Sector.

Ministry of Transport.name: National Land Transport Programme
Ministry of Transport.scope: The estimated amount to be spent on activities under the National Land Transport Programme, as authorised by section 9 (3) and (4) of the Land Transport Management Act 2003.

Ministry of Transport.name: NLTF Borrowing Facility for Short-Term Advances
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to short-term advances to the New Zealand Transport Agency to manage variations between cash outlays from and flows of hypothecated revenue into the National Land Transport Fund, with the maximum amount of such advances at any one time not exceeding $250 million.

Ministry of Transport.name: National Land Transport Programme - New Infrastructure for and Renewal of State Highways
Ministry of Transport.scope: The estimated amount to be spent on capital works for new infrastructure and renewal of State Highways, as authorised by Section 9 (3) and (4) of the Land Transport Management Act 2003.

Ministry of Transport.name: Rail - New Zealand Railways Corporation Loans
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to loans to the New Zealand Railways Corporation to fund capital projects and provide working capital.

Ministry of Transport.name: Rail - KiwiRail Turnaround Plan Funding
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to approved capital expenditure that contributes to the KiwiRail Turnaround Plan outcomes.

Ministry of Transport.name: Auckland Rail Development
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to the renewal, upgrade, and electrification of the Auckland metropolitan rail network.

Ministry of Transport.name: Rail - Metro Rail Rolling Stock and Infrastructure (Wellington)
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to metro rail rolling stock and infrastructure projects in Wellington.

Ministry of Transport.name: Motor Vehicle Registry
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to the registration and licensing of motor vehicles, the collection and refund of motor vehicle registration and licensing revenue, and the operation of the Motor Vehicle Register.

Ministry of Transport.name: Policy Advice
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to strategic, objective and evidence based policy advice that will promote the development of an effective and efficient transport system, and ministerial servicing.

Ministry of Transport.name: SuperGold Card - public transport concessions for cardholders
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing enhanced public transport concessions for SuperGold cardholders.

Ministry of Transport.name: Weather Forecasts and Warnings
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to severe-weather warnings and a level of weather forecast services for land, coastal waters and oceanic areas for which New Zealand has international responsibility.

Ministry of Transport.name: Road User Charges Collection, Investigation and Enforcement
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to the collection and refund of Road User Charges, and the investigation and enforcement of evasion of Road User Charges.

Ministry of Transport.name: Rail Network and Rolling Stock Upgrade
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to the renewal, upgrade and maintenance of the national rail network, and the New Zealand Railway Corporation’s rolling stock, terminals and systems.

Ministry of Transport.name: Wellington Metro Rail Network Upgrade
Ministry of Transport.scope: The appropriation is limited to catch up investment in the Wellington metro rail network which will enable sustainable operation of the network through the Metro Rail Operating model.

Ministry of Transport.name: Bad Debt Provision - Motor Vehicle Registration/Licenses and Road User Charges
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to provision for bad debts that arise from non payment of motor vehicle registrations and road user charges.

Ministry of Transport.name: Policy Advice on Safety Regulation and Monitoring – Maritime
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to policy advice on maritime safety, development of safety standards, promotion and auditing of maritime safety, and the review of legislation.

Ministry of Transport.name: Rail – Waikato Network Funding
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to rail projects which improve the capacity and connections of rail freight in the Waikato region.

Ministry of Transport.name: Canterbury Transport Project
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to assisting the Canterbury region to implement a land transport package.

Ministry of Transport.name: Search and Rescue and Recreational Boating Safety Activities
Ministry of Transport.scope: The estimated amount to be spent in relation to search and rescue and recreational boating safety activities, as authorised under Section 9 (1) of the Land Transport Management Act 2003.

Ministry of Transport.name: Accident or Incident Investigation and Reporting
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to investigation and reporting on aviation, rail and marine accidents and incidents in New Zealand and the waters over which it has jurisdiction.

Ministry of Transport.name: Search and Rescue Activities
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of search and rescue activities and a search and rescue coordination service, including follow-up inquiries and reporting, associated with the searches and rescues undertaken.

Ministry of Transport.name: Rail - Public Policy Projects
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to public policy rail initiatives.

Ministry of Transport.name: Licensing Activities
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to land transport licensing services, including driver licensing, not met by user fees.

Ministry of Transport.name: Policy Advice – Civil Aviation
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to policy advice on civil aviation safety, development of safety standards, promotion and auditing of aviation security, review of legislation, and administration of New Zealand's participation in ICAO and other safety related agreements.

Ministry of Transport.name: Regional Development Transport Funding
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to  regional development initiatives to develop the forestry roading infrastructure in Northland and Tairawhiti.

Ministry of Transport.name: Governance and Performance Advice for Crown Agencies
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to monitoring of and advice on the governance, performance and capability of transport Crown agencies.

Ministry of Transport.name: Search and Rescue Activity Coordination
Ministry of Transport.scope: The estimated amount to be spent on the coordination of search and rescue activities as authorised by section 9(1) of Land Transport Management Act 2003.

Ministry of Transport.name: Land Transport Revenue Forecasting and Strategy
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to land transport revenue forecasting, strategy and policy.

Ministry of Transport.name: Ministry of Transport - Capital Expenditure
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Ministry of Transport, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Ministry of Transport.name: Membership of International Organisations
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to non-discretionary payments to international transport related organisations.

Ministry of Transport.name: Ministerial Servicing by the New Zealand Transport Agency
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to Ministerial servicing by the New Zealand Transport Agency.

Ministry of Transport.name: New & Improved Infrastructure for State Highways - Crown Contribution
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to contributing towards the purchase of State highway improvements as outlined in the 2006/07 State Highway Forecast.

Ministry of Transport.name: Joint Venture Airports - Crown Contribution
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to enhancements to joint venture airport terminals and runways and the Crown's share of operating losses.

Ministry of Transport.name: Rail - Railway Safety
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to public safety works.

Ministry of Transport.name: Fuel Excise Duty Refund Administration
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to the receipt and processing of applications for, and the refunding of, Fuel Excise Duty.

Ministry of Transport.name: Aviation Security Service
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to meeting the ongoing capital costs of the security measures under international and domestic obligations, including accommodation and IT systems.

Ministry of Transport.name: Milford Sound / Piopiotahi Aerodrome Operation and Administration
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to the operation of Milford Sound/Piopiotahi aerodrome to provide a safe and efficient airport.

Ministry of Transport.name: Maritime Port Security
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to standby screening and searching services at ports.

Ministry of Transport.name: SuperGold Card - Administration of the Public Transport Concessions Scheme
Ministry of Transport.scope: This appropriation is limited to the administration costs of the scheme to provide enhanced public transport concessions for SuperGold cardholders.

Ministry of Women's Affairs.name: Policy Advice and Nomination Services
Ministry of Women's Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to policy advice on improving outcomes for women in New Zealand, nomination services, the management of New Zealand's international obligations related to the status of women, and associated ministerial support.

Ministry of Women's Affairs.name: Ministry of Women's Affairs - Capital Expenditure
Ministry of Women's Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Ministry of Women's Affairs, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

New Zealand Customs Service.name: Clearance and Enforcement Services Related to Goods
New Zealand Customs Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of services relating to goods crossing the border, including clearance of goods, assessment and audit of revenue, trade compliance and supply chain security assurance, and protection of New Zealand’s interests through interventions, audits, investigations and enforcement.

New Zealand Customs Service.name: New Zealand Customs Service - Capital Expenditure
New Zealand Customs Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the New Zealand Customs Service, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

New Zealand Customs Service.name: Clearance and Enforcement Services Related to Passengers and Crew
New Zealand Customs Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of services relating to passengers and crew crossing the border, including collecting information, clearance of people and their possessions, and protection of New Zealand’s interests through interventions, investigations and enforcement.

New Zealand Customs Service.name: Information and Intelligence Services
New Zealand Customs Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of information, intelligence and risk assessment services to external clients, and the operation of the National Maritime Coordination Centre.

New Zealand Customs Service.name: Policy Advice and International Services
New Zealand Customs Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of ministerial support, policy advice and international services, obligations and assistance.

New Zealand Customs Service.name: Clearance and Enforcement Services Related to Craft
New Zealand Customs Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of services relating to craft arriving in and departing from New Zealand, including clearance of craft, and protection of New Zealand’s interests through interventions, investigations and enforcement.

New Zealand Customs Service.name: Revenue Collection
New Zealand Customs Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of services relating to receipt and processing of revenues owing to the Crown and other agencies, revenue assurance, credit and debt management.

New Zealand Customs Service.name: Change in Doubtful Debt Provision
New Zealand Customs Service.scope: Provisioning of Doubtful Debts on Customs Crown Revenue.

New Zealand Customs Service.name: World Customs Organisation
New Zealand Customs Service.scope: New Zealand's contribution to the operating budget of the WCO.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: New Zealand Defence Force - Capital Expenditure
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the New Zealand Defence Force, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Naval Combat Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of the frigates, HMNZ Ships TE KAHA and TE MANA, prepared to conduct maritime operations and to contribute support services to the community, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Land Combat Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of the Land Combat Forces (command, control, intelligence and manoeuvre force elements) prepared to conduct land operations and to contribute support services to the community, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Fixed Wing Transport Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of No 40 Squadron RNZAF (Boeing 757-200 and C-130 Hercules aircraft) prepared to conduct strategic and tactical air transport operations, including aeromedical evacuation, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications, and to contribute support services to the community.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Land Combat Support Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of the Land Combat Support Forces (artillery, engineers, communications and military police force elements) prepared to conduct land operations and to contribute support services to the community, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Airborne Surveillance and Response Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of the capabilities of No 5 Squadron RNZAF (P-3K2 Orion aircraft) prepared to conduct airborne surveillance of New Zealand's EEZ, the Pacific region and the Southern Ocean, to conduct search and rescue missions, and to conduct maritime and land air operations, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications. This output expense also includes some support services to the community.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Land Combat Service Support Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of the Land Combat Service Support Forces (transport, medical, supply, maintenance support and movements force elements) prepared to support land operations and to contribute support services to the community, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Rotary Wing Transport Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of No 3 Squadron RNZAF (Iroquois helicopters) prepared to conduct tactical air transport, including aeromedical evacuation, and counter-terrorist operations, and to contribute support services to the community, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Naval Patrol Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of the Offshore and Inshore Patrol Vessels (OPVs, IPVs) prepared for the conduct of maritime operations in support of Multi-Agency Operations and Tasks (MAO&T), and for the security and protection of New Zealand's economic border and EEZ, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications. The OPVs will also be prepared to conduct sovereignty and resource protection patrol operations in the Southern Ocean, Ross Dependency, South Pacific region and further afield when directed.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: War Disablement Pensions
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to the payment of War Disablement Pensions to ex-service people who have a disability attributable to, or aggravated by, service in a declared war or emergency at any time, or in routine service prior to 1 April 1974 as set out in the War Pensions Act 1954, the payment of Surviving Spouse Pensions as set out in the War Pensions Act 1954 and the payment of allowances as set out in the War Pensions Act 1954 and the War Pensions Regulations 1956.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Naval Support Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of the Fleet Replenishment Ship, HMNZS ENDEAVOUR, and the Multi-Role Vessel, HMNZS CANTERBURY, prepared to conduct maritime logistic support and amphibious sealift operations for deployed military forces, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications.  This output expense also includes contributions to a range of services provided to Government and the community.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Naval Helicopter Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of No 6 Squadron RNZAF (Seasprite SH-2G helicopters) prepared to conduct maritime operations in support of other Output Expenses, especially the Naval Combat Forces, Naval Support Forces and Naval Patrol Forces, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Special Operations Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of the Special Operations Forces prepared to conduct special forces operations in support of land operations, counter-terrorist operations, and the provision of Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Explosive, Improvised Explosive Device Disposal (CBRE IEDD) that threaten public safety or national interests, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Operationally Deployed Forces Annual
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: The provision of deployed force elements on military tasks, including the commitments agreed by Government under which the NZDF contributes to peace support and other operations conducted in support of the United Nations and other international agencies.  It includes the provision of individuals, observers, advisers, instructors, headquarters staff, and complete force elements and contingents.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Mine Countermeasures (MCM) and MCM Diving Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of the Mine Countermeasures (MCM) Forces, including HMNZS MANAWANUI, prepared to conduct route surveys and conditioning of selected New Zealand ports, and the provision of the Operational Diving Team prepared to support MCM operations and to conduct independent diving tasks, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications. This output expense also includes some support services to the community.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Medical Treatment
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to the payment of assessment costs as set out in the War Pensions Regulations 1956 for War Disablement Pension applications and reviews, medical treatment costs for accepted service-related disabilities, and the costs of appliances and aids required as a result of an accepted disability.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Military Policy Development, Coordination and Advice
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of advice to the Minister of Defence on military contributions to New Zealand's foreign policy and military responses to contingencies, in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications.  This output expense also includes military intelligence, responses to ministerial correspondence, select committee and parliamentary questions, Official Information Act inquiries, and Ombudsmen correspondence.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Military Hydrography, and Hydrographic Data Collection and Processing for LINZ
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: Provision of the capabilities of the hydrographic and oceanographic survey vessel, HMNZS RESOLUTION, specialist personnel and support infrastructure to conduct military hydrography in accordance with NZDF Output Plan specifications, and hydrographic data collection and processing that meets contractual commitments to Land Information New Zealand (LINZ).  This output expense is supported by the Hydrographic Business Unit.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Support to Youth Development
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This output class is limited to New Zealand Defence Force support to government initiated youth development schemes in New Zealand, being the conduct of Limited Service Volunteer courses and contributions to Youth Life Skills programmes (Service Academies and Military-style Activity Camps).

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Support to Service Military Museums
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This output class is limited to collection development, collection management and exhibits related to New Zealand's military history.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Services and Payments to Veterans
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to the assessment, review and payment of entitlements and benefits (War Disablement Pensions and related concessions and allowances, Surviving Spouse Pensions), the assessment and review of entitlement for burial in Service Cemeteries, the installation of ex-service memorials for eligible veterans, and the provision of case management for veterans and their families.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Support to New Zealand Cadet Forces
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of leadership and skills training for all approved New Zealand Cadet Force (NZCF) units.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Support to Mutual Assistance Programme (MAP)
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of training, technical advice and resource support to the defence forces of MAP partner countries, both in New Zealand and in the partner countries. Specialist niche training is also provided to the law enforcement agencies of South Pacific MAP partner countries.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Maintenance of Assets Awaiting Sale
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to costs necessary to keep assets awaiting sale in a saleable condition.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Policy and Administration
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: The purchase of the provision of policy advice on, and administration of, a wide range of issues relating to veterans' entitlements, care, and recognition.  This includes the provision of administrative services to relevant boards and committees, the coordination of commemorations, the administration of contracts for service for, and undertaking quality audits of, maintenance and development work carried out in Services Cemeteries.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Ex-Gratia Payments and Comprehensive Medical Assessments for Vietnam Veterans
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to the ex-gratia payments to Vietnam veterans and/or members of their family with accepted conditions and for the annual comprehensive medical assessments for Vietnam Veterans.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Support for Veterans and Their Families
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing for the support of veterans and their families. This includes the provision of counselling for veterans' families, the reimbursement of out of pocket expenses for veterans' children with specified conditions; additional support for veterans to facilitate them remaining in their own homes for as long as possible; additional support to facilitate veterans' rehabilitation; support for the surviving partner after the death of the veteran and for the provision of grants to Non-Government Organisations for the support of veterans and their families.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Development and Maintenance of Services Cemeteries
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: The purchase of the development and maintenance of Services Cemeteries.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Disposal of Decommissioned Assets
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to the disposal costs of decommissioned assets.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Debt Write-down for Benefits and Other Unrequited Expenses (BOUE)
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to the write-down of Crown debtors administered by the New Zealand Defence Force due to the requirement to comply with Crown accounting policies and generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Special Annuities
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to paying annuities authorised by Cabinet to recognise a special contribution by the recipient to New Zealand Society.

New Zealand Defence Force.name: Interest Concessions Land and Buildings
New Zealand Defence Force.scope: This appropriation is limited to provision for grandparented loans of the differential between the 3% or 5% Rehabilitation Loan rate and the current market rate as set out in the  Rehabilitation Act 1941.

New Zealand Police.name: Police Primary Response Management
New Zealand Police.scope: Communication Centres providing advice and information to callers, dispatching response vehicles to calls for assistance and the initial attendance at incidents and emergencies.

New Zealand Police.name: Investigations
New Zealand Police.scope: Delivery of investigative services including criminal investigations, non-criminal investigations and Police internal investigations.

New Zealand Police.name: Road Safety Programme
New Zealand Police.scope: This output class covers the delivery of services outlined in the New Zealand Road Safety Programme directed towards the achievement of the road safety outcomes.

New Zealand Police.name: New Zealand Police - Capital Expenditure
New Zealand Police.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the New Zealand Police, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

New Zealand Police.name: General Crime Prevention Services
New Zealand Police.scope: Delivery of services to the community, to help prevent crime including: providing advice to reduce the risk of personal harm and increase the security of property; youth focused crime prevention and community safety services; vetting services for other agencies; firearms licensing; and dealing with lost and found property.

New Zealand Police.name: Case Resolution and Support to Judicial Process
New Zealand Police.scope: Delivery of services for: prosecuting criminal cases; resolving non-criminal cases; executing court orders; fines warrants; arrest warrants; escorting and holding people in police cells following arrest; the custody and escort of arrested; remand and sentenced prisoners as directed by the court; and the care, and when necessary, the temporary custody of people with mental health problems.

New Zealand Police.name: Specific Crime Prevention Services and Maintenance of Public Order
New Zealand Police.scope: Delivery of specific crime prevention activities undertaken by Police that target risk areas, including: strategies which focus on reducing repeat victimisation for violence, burglary and vehicle offences; maintaining order at demonstrations and public events; providing security to court staff, witnesses and accused persons; providing security services at domestic airports and for international flights; deploying staff overseas; providing secretarial support to the Pacific Islands Chiefs of Police; and proactive patrolling.

New Zealand Police.name: Policy Advice and Ministerial Servicing
New Zealand Police.scope: Ministerial services, drafting replies to ministerial questions, and policy advice on policing issues.

New Zealand Police.name: United Nations Drug Control Programme
New Zealand Police.scope: United Nations Drug Control Programme contribution.

New Zealand Police.name: Compensation for Confiscated Firearms
New Zealand Police.scope: Compensation paid to owners of firearms confiscated under the provisions of section 28(4) of the Arms Act 1983.

New Zealand Security Intelligence Servic.name: Security Intelligence
New Zealand Security Intelligence Servic.scope: This appropriation is limited to the operating and investing activities of the New Zealand Security Intelligence Service.

Office of the Clerk of the House of Repr.name: Secretariat Services for the House of Representatives
Office of the Clerk of the House of Repr.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision to the House of Representatives of professional advice and services designed to assist the House in the fulfilment of its constitutional functions, and enabling participation in, and understanding of, parliamentary proceedings.

Office of the Clerk of the House of Repr.name: Office of the Clerk of the House of Representatives - Capital Expenditure
Office of the Clerk of the House of Repr.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Office of the Clerk of the House of Representatives, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Office of the Clerk of the House of Repr.name: Inter-parliamentary Relations
Office of the Clerk of the House of Repr.scope: This appropriation is limited to services to improve relations between the New Zealand Parliament and other parliaments, including providing advice on inter-parliamentary relations to the Speaker and members, establishing and implementing an annual programme of incoming and outgoing visits, developing and implementing individual visit programmes, assisting to build the capacity of the Pacific Island parliaments, supporting (including through travel to meetings overseas) the New Zealand Parliament's contribution on global issues at international parliamentary organisations and hosting international parliamentary conferences.

Office of the Ombudsmen.name: Investigation and Resolution of Complaints About Government Administration
Office of the Ombudsmen.scope: This appropriation is limited to the investigation, resolution of complaints and the provision of advice relating to central and local government administrative actions, and monitoring compliance with international conventions.

Office of the Ombudsmen.name: Remuneration of Ombudsmen
Office of the Ombudsmen.scope: This appropriation is limited to remuneration expenses for the Ombudsmen as authorised by sections 8 and 9 of the Ombudsmen Act 1975.

Office of the Ombudsmen.name: Office of the Ombudsmen - Capital Expenditure
Office of the Ombudsmen.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Office of the Ombudsmen, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Parliamentary Commissioner for the Envir.name: Reports and Advice
Parliamentary Commissioner for the Envir.scope: This appropriation is limited to reviewing, investigating, providing reports and advice on the legal and other systems governing management of the environment and the performance of central and local government agencies in maintaining and improving the quality of the environment.

Parliamentary Commissioner for the Envir.name: Remuneration of the Parliamentary Commissioner for the Environment
Parliamentary Commissioner for the Envir.scope: This appropriation is limited to remuneration expenses for the Parliamentary Commissioner for the Environment as authorised by section 9 of the Environment Act 1986.

Parliamentary Commissioner for the Envir.name: Parliamentary Commissioner for the Environment - Capital Expenditure
Parliamentary Commissioner for the Envir.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Parliamentary Commissioner for the Environment, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Parliamentary Counsel Office.name: Access to Legislation
Parliamentary Counsel Office.scope: This appropriation is limited to supplying printed copies of Government Bills and Supplementary Order Papers to the House; publishing legislation and distributing it through designated bookshops and by subscription; reprinting legislation with the amendments incorporated; publishing tables of legislation; providing free public access via the Internet to a database of up-to-date legislation.

Parliamentary Counsel Office.name: Law Drafting Services
Parliamentary Counsel Office.scope: This appropriation is limited to drafting Government Bills (including amendments) and Statutory Regulations, examining and reporting on local Bills and private Bills and drafting amendments to them.

Parliamentary Counsel Office.name: Parliamentary Counsel Office - Capital Expenditure
Parliamentary Counsel Office.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Parliamentary Counsel Office, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Parliamentary Service.name: Building and Operations Management
Parliamentary Service.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of building maintenance and operational services for the parliamentary precincts.

Parliamentary Service.name: Services to Members
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of services to Office of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and of support staff to members and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates and former members in accordance with Directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Members of the House of Representatives' Salaries and Allowances
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses incurred under section 16 of the Civil List Act 1979 and incorporates salaries and allowances determined by the Remuneration Authority, payable to members of Parliament who are neither Ministers of the Crown nor Parliamentary Under-Secretaries.

Parliamentary Service.name: Parliamentary Information Services
Parliamentary Service.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of library and electronic information services through the Parliamentary Library; the provision of computing facilities; and computing and telecommunications advisory services associated with these.

Parliamentary Service.name: Depreciation Expense on Parliamentary Complex
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the depreciation expense on the Parliamentary buildings, furniture, antiques and art collection, and the library collection.

Parliamentary Service.name: Travel of Members and Others
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to domestic accommodation, air, land and sea travel, and international air travel for members, spouses/partners and dependents, electoral candidates and their spouses/partners and dependents, former members and spouses/partners, political exchange participants and officials as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Party and Member Support - National
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding for the National parliamentary party to support its Leader's office, research operations, Whips' office, members' and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' parliamentary operations as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Personnel and Accounting Services to Members and Other Agencies
Parliamentary Service.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to members, Leader and Whip offices, electoral candidates and former members, providing travel, accounting, staffing advice and support, health safety and wellness, payroll services; and, bureau accounting and payroll services to other parliamentary agencies.

Parliamentary Service.name: Party and Member Support - Labour
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding for the Labour parliamentary party to support its Leader's office, research operations, Whips' office, members' and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' parliamentary operations as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Crown Asset Management
Parliamentary Service.scope: Minor Capital works within the Parliamentary Complex to carry out essential maintenance and minor capital improvements.

Parliamentary Service.name: Parliamentary Service - Capital Expenditure
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Parliamentary Service, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Parliamentary Service.name: Members' Communications
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to members’ and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' communications (voice and data) entitlements, and members’ and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' use of standard office products and stationery supplies as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Party and Member Support - Green
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding for the Green parliamentary party to support its Co-Leaders' office, research operations, Parliamentary musterer's office, members' and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' parliamentary operations as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Policy Advice
Parliamentary Service.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of information, analysis and advice to the Speaker, the Parliamentary Service Commission, and the Parliamentary Corporation.

Parliamentary Service.name: Party and Member Support - Maori
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding for the Maori parliamentary party to support its Co-Leader's office, research operations, Whips' office, members' and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' parliamentary operations as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Party and Member Support - ACT
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding for the ACT parliamentary party to support its Leader's office, research operations, Whip's office, members' and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' parliamentary operations as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Party and Member Support - Progressive Coalition
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding for the Progressive Coalition parliamentary party to support its Leader's office, research operations, member's and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' parliamentary operations as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Party and Member Support - United Future
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding for the United Future parliamentary party to support its Leader's office, research operations, member's and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' parliamentary operations as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Parliamentary Service.name: Member Support - Independent
Parliamentary Service.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding for the Independent members' and, during the immediate post election period, electoral candidates' and former members' parliamentary operations as allowed under directions given by the Speaker.

Serious Fraud Office.name: Investigation and Prosecution of Complex or Serious Fraud
Serious Fraud Office.scope: The detection, investigation and prosecution of cases of suspected serious fraud offending brought to the attention of, or detected by, the Serious Fraud Office.

Serious Fraud Office.name: Serious Fraud Office - Capital Expenditure
Serious Fraud Office.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Serious Fraud Office, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

State Services Commission.name: State Sector Retirement Savings Scheme: State Sector Employer Contributions
State Services Commission.scope: This appropriation is limited to the reimbursement of employer contributions to the State Sector Retirement Savings Scheme for employees of Public Service and non-Public Service departments and in the Education Service.

State Services Commission.name: KiwiSaver: State Sector Employer Contributions
State Services Commission.scope: This appropriation is limited to the reimbursement of the net cost of compulsory employer contributions to KiwiSaver above the employer tax credits received for employees of State sector employers who are not members of other subsidised schemes.

State Services Commission.name: Chief Executive and Agency Performance Management
State Services Commission.scope: This appropriation is limited to the State Services chief executive appointment and performance management and advice on governance and performance of agencies in the State Services.

State Services Commission.name: Remuneration and Related Employment Costs of Chief Executives
State Services Commission.scope: This appropriation is limited to the remuneration and costs relating to the employment of chief executives employed by the State Services Commissioner.

State Services Commission.name: Public Management System
State Services Commission.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of advice, standards and leadership in relation to the performance, efficiency and effectiveness of the public management system.

State Services Commission.name: State Services Commission - Capital Expenditure
State Services Commission.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the State Services Commission, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

State Services Commission.name: Settlement of Legal Liabilities
State Services Commission.scope: The settlement of legal liabilities incurred by now-disestablished government departments and other Crown settlements.

Statistics New Zealand.name: Population, Social and Labour Force Statistical Information Services
Statistics New Zealand.scope: Delivery of statistical information services relating to the population, environment, household economics, social conditions, and the labour force.

Statistics New Zealand.name: Economic and Business Statistical Information Services
Statistics New Zealand.scope: Delivery of statistical information services relating to business and the economy.

Statistics New Zealand.name: Statistics New Zealand - Capital Expenditure
Statistics New Zealand.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Statistics New Zealand, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Statistics New Zealand.name: Coordination of Government Statistical Activities
Statistics New Zealand.scope: Leadership of the OSS, including liaison with OSS partners, provision of ministerial services, statistical advice, and the operation of access channels.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Maori Television Broadcasting
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Promotion of Maori language and Maori culture through television broadcasting.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Service Delivery Capability
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This output class is limited to support for providers to develop whanau ora service delivery capability.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Maori Television Channel
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Administration costs of the Maori Television channel.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Policy - Economic and Enterprise
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Advice on policies and programmes that specifically impact on the economic and enterprise status of Maori people and resources. It includes the provision of Maori business development services.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Maori Radio Broadcasting
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Promotion of Maori language and Maori culture through radio broadcasting.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Maori Trustee Functions
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of trustee and land management functions from the Maori Trustee.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Whanau Ora Administration
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to activities associated with implementing, developing and evaluating the whanau ora service delivery approach.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Operations Management
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to the design, delivery and management of community investment programmes and management of land administered under Part 2 of the Maori Affairs Restructuring Act 1989.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Policy - Crown Maori Relationships
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Advice on relationships between Maori people and the Crown. It includes Treaty policy issues and advice on the impact of legislation.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Policy - Social and Cultural
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Advice on policies and programmes that specifically impact on the social and cultural status of Maori people and resources.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Relationships and Information
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Strengthening relationships with Maori, with emphasis on brokerage, co-ordination and facilitation to assist Maori to achieve their economic, social and cultural aspirations.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Whakamana (Leadership)
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Purchasing partnered interventions, tools and investigative studies to strengthen Maori leadership, governance and management to accelerate Maori development.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Rawa (Resources)
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Purchasing partnered interventions, tools and investigative studies to support Maori access to, utilisation, development and retention of resources required to accelerate Maori development.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Integrated Whanau Social Assistance
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to community level social assistance through the provision of Whanau Advocates and Maori Wardens programmes.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Whanau Integration, Innovation and Engagement
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This output class is limited to support for providers to develop whanau integration, innovation and engagement.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Matauranga (Knowledge)
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Purchasing partnered interventions, tools and investigative studies to support Maori in the acquisition, creation, maintenance and transferral of traditional and contemporary knowledge required to accelerate Maori development.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Promotion of the Maori Language
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Purchase of initiatives to revitalise and develop the Maori language in New Zealand. This includes outputs from Te Taura Whiri I Te Reo Maori (Maori Language Commission) and involves the promotion of the Maori language in New Zealand.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Maori Women’s Development Fund
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Provide for the administration of government funding for the Maori Women’s Development Fund.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Te Puni Kokiri - Capital Expenditure
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of Te Puni Kokiri, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Administration of Maori Broadcasting
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Purchase of administration services from Te Mangai Paho to meet its statutory functions and deliver on the Government's Maori broadcasting policy.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Strengthening and Promoting Maori Tourism
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to payments to providers to strengthen the strategic leadership of the Maori Tourism sector, facilitate improvements in the capability and capacity of Maori tourism product, and promote Maori tourism.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Maori Wardens
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Assistance to the National Maori Wardens Association to meet administrative costs and to provide funding to Maori Wardens for locally based initiatives that focus on improving outcomes for Maori youth and Whanau.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Growing Maori Productivity and Export Growth
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to payments to providers to improve skills, training and governance across the productive sectors targeted at, and appropriate to, Maori asset holders and businesses.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Maori Registration Service
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Contribution towards the ongoing cost of a national Maori registration service, which will assist in linking Maori with their tribes and tribal groups and compiling comprehensive and accurate registers of their members.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Turanganui-a-Kiwa Capacity Building
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to capacity building funding to the Turanganui-a-Kiwa post-settlement entities.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Rangatiratanga Grants
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Financial assistance to promote and enhance initiatives for the social, economic and cultural advancement of Maori.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Iwi Housing Support
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Provision of capacity building support for Special Housing Action Zones.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Maori Trustee Capital
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to payments to support the capital requirements of the stand-alone Maori Trustee established under the Maori Trustee Amendment Act 2009.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: NZ Maori Council
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Administration costs of the New Zealand Maori Council.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Te Putahi Paoho
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Administration costs of Te Putahi Paoho (the Maori Television Electoral College).

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Administrative expenses for Crown Land
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: This appropriation is limited to funding the direct costs of Crown owned land administered by Te Puni Kokiri under Part 2 of the Maori Affairs Restructuring Act 1989.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Te Ariki Trust
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Costs of administering the Te Ariki Trust.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Payments to Trust Boards
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Payment of annuities to Maori Trust Boards, in accordance with sections 4(2), 9(2) and 10(2) of the Maori Trust Boards Act 1955.

Te Puni Kokiri.name: Orakei Act 1991
Te Puni Kokiri.scope: Orakei Reserves Board fees and travel expenses in accordance with Section 29 of the Orakei Act 1991.

The Treasury.name: Debt Servicing
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the payment of borrowing expenses for the Crown's New Zealand-dollar and foreign-currency debt, authorised by section 60(1)b of the Public Finance Act 1989.

The Treasury.name: Government Superannuation Fund Unfunded Liability
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the net increase (excluding actuarial gains and losses) in the Crown’s liability to the Government Superannuation Fund and the specified superannuation contribution withholding tax on employer contributions by the Crown, authorised by section 95AA of the Government Superannuation Act 1956.

The Treasury.name: International Financial Institutions
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to capital expenditure for shares subscribed to by New Zealand as a member of International Financial Institutions, authorised by section 5 of the International Finance Agreements Act 1961.

The Treasury.name: National Provident Fund Schemes -  Liability Under Crown Guarantee
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the net increase (excluding actuarial gains and losses) in the Crown's liability for benefits payable to members of National Provident Fund schemes under the Crown guarantee in section 60 of the National Provident Fund Restructuring Act 1990. This appropriation is authorised by section 66 of the National Provident Fund Restructuring Act 1990.

The Treasury.name: Policy Advice - Finance
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to activities supporting the budget process, fiscal management and reporting, the management of liabilities, claims against the Crown and Crown properties, and policy advice and ministerial services regarding fiscal, economic, tax and regulatory matters and state sector performance.

The Treasury.name: Government Superannuation Fund Authority – Crown’s Share of Expenses
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the Crown’s share of the expenses of the Government Superannuation Fund Authority relating to the management and administration of the Government Superannuation Fund and the schemes, authorised by sections 15E and 95 of the Government Superannuation Act 1956.

The Treasury.name: New Zealand House, London
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the operational costs of New Zealand House, London.

The Treasury.name: Management and Administration of Financial Operations on behalf of the Crown
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the implementation of the Government’s Export Guarantees policy, the operation of the New Zealand Export Credit Office, and the provision of advice on, and management of, Crown Guarantee Schemes, Crown lending, Crown Bank Accounts and Crown Investments.

The Treasury.name: Extending the Mixed Ownership Model
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to policy, operational, and transactional work to extend the Mixed Ownership Model.

The Treasury.name: Administration of Crown Borrowing
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses incurred in connection with administering borrowing by the Crown, as authorised by section 61(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

The Treasury.name: Infrastructure Advice and Coordination
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of advice to the Government and to Government agencies on infrastructure, ensuring  coordination and implementation of the Government’s infrastructure activities, the formulation and implementation of the National Infrastructure Plan, monitoring of infrastructure investment and frameworks,  and operation of the National Infrastructure Advisory Board.

The Treasury.name: Inquiries into Productivity - Related Matters
The Treasury.scope: This output class is limited to inquiries undertaken by the New Zealand Productivity Commission in accordance with the New Zealand Productivity Commission Act 2010.

The Treasury.name: Crown Company Monitoring Advice to the Minister for State-Owned Enterprises and Other Responsible Ministers
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of ownership, performance monitoring and governance advice to the Minister for State Owned Enterprises and other responsible Ministers in respect of the Ministers' shareholding responsibilities or as responsible Ministers for the New Zealand Lotteries Commission and Public Trust.

The Treasury.name: The Treasury - Capital Expenditure
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Treasury, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

The Treasury.name: Dispute Resolution Services Limited Equity Transfer
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the transfer of equity of Dispute Resolution Services Limited from ACC to the Crown with shareholding Ministers being the Minister of Finance and Minister for ACC.

The Treasury.name: Administration of Guarantees and Indemnities given by the Crown
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses incurred in connection with administering of guarantees and indemnities given by the Crown, as authorised by section 65ZG of the Public Finance Act 1989.

The Treasury.name: Crown Company Monitoring Advice to the Minister of Science and Innovation and the Minister for Economic Development
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of ownership, performance monitoring, and governance advice to the Minister of Science and Innovation and other responsible Ministers in respect of the Ministers' shareholding responsibilities.

The Treasury.name: Administration of Derivative Transactions
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses incurred in connection with administering derivative transactions of the Crown, as authorised by section 65H(2) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

The Treasury.name: Management of New Zealand House, London
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the property management services in respect of New Zealand House, London.

The Treasury.name: Administration of Investment of Public Money
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses incurred in connection with administering the investment of public money, as authorised by section 65J(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

The Treasury.name: Impairment of Loans to Taitokerau Forest Limited
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the expense incurred on the impairment of new loans to Taitokerau Forests Limited.

The Treasury.name: Taitokerau Forests
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of loans to Taitokerau Forests Ltd for forest management and development.

The Treasury.name: Management of the New Zealand Superannuation Fund
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to managing the New Zealand Superannuation Fund on behalf of the Crown.

The Treasury.name: Geothermal Wells Fund
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to meeting the costs of one-off unforeseen events relating to those geothermal wells for which the Crown accepts responsibility.

The Treasury.name: Research into and Promotion of Productivity - Related Matters
The Treasury.scope: This output class is limited to the New Zealand Productivity Commission undertaking research into and promoting public understanding of productivity related matters in accordance with the New Zealand Productivity Commission Act 2010.

The Treasury.name: Taitokerau Forests Limited Grant
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to grants to Taitokerau Forests Limited for on-payment to forest owners, payable upon harvest of the forests.

The Treasury.name: Unclaimed Money
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the repayment of money authorised by section 74(5) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

The Treasury.name: Unclaimed Trust Money
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the repayment of money authorised by section 70(2) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

The Treasury.name: Crown Residual Liabilities
The Treasury.scope: Residual obligations arising from administration of the Crown's sale and purchase agreements with SOEs and Crown entities and from the sale of Crown investments, and for the settlement of claims against the Crown arising from exposure to asbestos.

The Treasury.name: Management of the Crown's Obligations for Geothermal Wells
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the management and maintenance relating to geothermal wells and associated sites and structures for which the Crown accepts responsibility.

The Treasury.name: Government Superannuation Appeals Board
The Treasury.scope: This appropriation is limited to the expenses of the Government Superannuation Appeals Board in performing its functions under the Government Superannuation Fund Act 1956.
